alert.note: Alert for City of Winchester; Frederick; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:38PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snow melt is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Virginia and western Virginia, including the following counties: in northwest Virginia, City of Winchester, Frederick, Page, Shenandoah and Warren. In western Virginia, Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 336 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain had occurred. Flooding is already occurring, with several roads closed near small streams in the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisonburg... Winchester... Front Royal... Strasburg... Woodstock... Millwood Pike... Luray... Broadway... Timberville... Shenandoah... Massanutten... Mount Jackson... Stephens City... Stanley... Star Tannery... Basye-Bryce Mountain... Linden... Elkton... New Market... Middletown... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Winchester; Frederick; Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren
